And their ambassadors arrive at Hanes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Everyone will be ashamed because of a people who do not benefit them,
Who are not a help or benefit, but a source of shame and also disgrace.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The pronouncement concerning the animals of the Negev:
Through a land of distress and anguish,
From where come lioness and lion, viper and flying serpent,
They carry their riches on the backs of young donkeys,
And their treasures on camels’ humps,
To a people who will not benefit them;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even Egypt, whose help is vain and empty.
Therefore, I have called her
“Rahab who has been exterminated.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now go, write it on a tablet in their presence
And inscribe it on a scroll,
That it may serve in the time to come
As a witness forever.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Who say to the seers, “You must not see visions”;
And to the prophets, “You must not prophesy the truth to us.
Speak to us pleasant words,
Prophesy illusions.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Get out of the way, turn aside from the path,
Stop speaking before us about the Holy One of Israel!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore this is what the Holy One of Israel says:
“Since you have rejected this word
And have put your trust in oppression and crookedness, and have relied on them,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore this wrongdoing will be to you
Like a breach about to fall,
A bulge in a high wall,
Whose collapse comes suddenly in an instant,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Whose collapse is like the smashing of a potter’s jar,
So ruthlessly shattered
That a shard will not be found among its pieces
To take fire from a hearth
Or to scoop water from a cistern.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
For this is what the Lord God, the Holy One of Israel, has said:
“In repentance and rest you will be saved,
In quietness and trust is your strength.”
But you were not willing,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And you said, “No, for we will flee on horses!”
Therefore you shall flee!
“And we will ride on swift horses!”
Therefore those who pursue you shall be swift.
speaker: Narrator

text:
One thousand will flee at the threat of one man;
You will flee at the threat of five,
Until you are left like a signal post on a mountain top,
And like a flag on a hill.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore the Lord longs to be gracious to you,
And therefore He waits on high to have compassion on you.
For the Lord is a God of justice;
How blessed are all those who long for Him.
speaker: Narrator

text: For, you people in Zion, inhabitant in Jerusalem, you will weep no longer. He will certainly be gracious to you at the sound of your cry; when He hears it, He will answer you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Although the Lord has given you bread of deprivation and water of oppression, He, your Teacher, will no longer hide Himself, but your eyes will see your Teacher.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your ears will hear a word behind you, saying, “This is the way, walk in it,” whenever you turn to the right or to the left.
speaker: Narrator

text: And you will desecrate your carved images plated with silver, and your cast metal images plated with gold. You will scatter them as a filthy thing, and say to them, “Be gone!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then He will give you rain for your seed which you will sow in the ground, and bread from the yield of the ground, and it will be rich and plentiful; on that day your livestock will graze in a wide pasture.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the oxen and the donkeys that work the ground will eat seasoned feed, which has been winnowed with shovel and pitchfork.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on every lofty mountain and every high hill there will be streams running with water on the day of the great slaughter, when the towers fall.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the light of the full moon will be like the light of the sun, and the light of the sun will be seven times brighter, like the light of seven days, on the day the Lord binds up the fracture of His people and heals the wound He has inflicted.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
His breath is like an overflowing river,
Which reaches to the neck,
To shake the nations back and forth in a sieve,
And to put in the jaws of the peoples the bridle which leads astray.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will have songs as in the night when you keep the festival,
And gladness of heart as when one marches to the sound of the flute,
To go to the mountain of the Lord, to the Rock of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And the Lord will cause His voice of authority to be heard,
And the descending of His arm to be seen in fierce anger,
And in the flame of a consuming fire
In cloudburst, downpour, and hailstones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For at the voice of the Lord Assyria will be terrified,
When He strikes with the rod.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And every blow of the rod of punishment,
Which the Lord will lay on him,
Will be with the music of tambourines and lyres;
And in battles, brandishing weapons, He will fight them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For Topheth has long been ready,
Indeed, it has been prepared for the king.
He has made it deep and large,
A pyre of fire with plenty of wood;
The breath of the Lord, like a torrent of brimstone, sets it afire.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Woe to those who go down to Egypt for help
And rely on horses,
And trust in chariots because they are many
And in horsemen because they are very strong,
But they do not look to the Holy One of Israel, nor seek the Lord!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet He also is wise and will bring disaster,
And does not retract His words,
But will arise against the house of evildoers,
And against the help of the workers of injustice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Now the Egyptians are human and not God,
And their horses are flesh and not spirit;
So the Lord will stretch out His hand,
And any helper will stumble,
And one who is helped will fall.
And all of them will come to an end together.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For this is what the Lord says to me:
“As the lion or the young lion growls over his prey,
Against which a band of shepherds is called out,
And he will not be terrified at their voice nor disturbed at their noise,
So will the Lord of armies come down to wage war on Mount Zion and on its hill.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: Return to Him against whom you have been profoundly obstinate, you sons of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: For on that day every person will reject his silver idols and his gold idols, which your hands have made for you as a sin.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And the Assyrian will fall by a sword not wielded by a man,
And a sword not of man will devour him.
So he will not escape the sword,
And his young men will become forced laborers.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“His rock will pass away because of panic,
And his officers will be terrified by the flag,”
Declares the Lord, whose fire is in Zion and whose furnace is in Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, a king will reign righteously,
And officials will rule justly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Each will be like a refuge from the wind
And a shelter from the storm,
Like streams of water in a dry country,
Like the shade of a huge rock in an exhausted land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the eyes of those who see will not be blinded,
And the ears of those who hear will listen.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The mind of the rash will discern the truth,
And the tongue of the stammerers will hurry to speak clearly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
No longer will the fool be called noble,
Or the rogue be spoken of as generous.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For a fool speaks nonsense,
And his heart inclines toward wickedness:
To practice ungodliness and to speak error against the Lord,
To keep the hungry person unsatisfied
And to withhold drink from the thirsty.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for a rogue, his weapons are evil;
He devises wicked schemes
To destroy the poor with slander,
Even though the needy one speaks what is right.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the noble person devises noble plans;
And by noble plans he stands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Rise up, you women who are at ease,
And hear my voice;
Listen to my word,
You complacent daughters.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Within a year and a few days
You will be troubled, you complacent daughters;
For the vintage is ended,
And the fruit gathering will not come.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: Beat your breasts for the pleasant fields, for the fruitful vine,
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the land of my people in which thorns and briars will come up;
Indeed, for all the joyful houses and for the jubilant city.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the palace has been neglected, the populated city abandoned.
Hill and watch-tower have become caves forever,
A delight for wild donkeys, a pasture for flocks,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Until the Spirit is poured out upon us from on high,
And the wilderness becomes a fertile field,
And the fertile field is considered as a forest.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then justice will dwell in the wilderness,
And righteousness will remain in the fertile field.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And the work of righteousness will be peace,
And the service of righteousness, quietness and confidence forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then my people will live in a peaceful settlement,
In secure dwellings, and in undisturbed resting places;
speaker: Narrator

text:
And it will hail when the forest comes down,
And the city will be utterly laid low.
speaker: Narrator

text:
How blessed will you be, you who sow beside all waters,
Who let the ox and the donkey out freely.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Lord, be gracious to us; we have waited for You.
Be their strength every morning,
Our salvation also in the time of distress.
speaker: Narrator

text:
At the sound of a roar, peoples flee;
At the lifting up of Yourself, nations disperse.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your plunder is gathered as the caterpillar gathers;
Like an infestation of locusts, people storm it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord is exalted, for He dwells on high;
He has filled Zion with justice and righteousness.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Behold, their brave men cry out in the streets,
The ambassadors of peace weep bitterly.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The highways are desolate, the traveler has ceased,
He has broken the covenant, he has despised the cities,
He has no regard for mankind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The land mourns and wastes away,
Lebanon is shamed and withers;
Sharon is like a desert plain,
And Bashan and Carmel lose their foliage.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Now I will arise,” says the Lord,
“Now I will be exalted, now I will be lifted up.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have conceived chaff, you will give birth to stubble;
My breath will consume you like a fire.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The peoples will be burned to lime,
Like cut thorns which are burned in the fire.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“You who are far away, hear what I have done;
And you who are near, acknowledge My might.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Sinners in Zion are terrified;
Trembling has seized the godless.
“Who among us can live with the consuming fire?
Who among us can live with everlasting burning?”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
He will dwell on the heights,
His refuge will be the impregnable rock;
His bread will be given him,
His water will be sure.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your eyes will see the King in His beauty;
They will see a distant land.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your heart will meditate on terror:
“Where is one who counts?
Where is one who weighs?
Where is one who counts the towers?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will no longer see a fierce people,
A people of unintelligible speech which no one comprehends,
Of a stammering tongue which no one understands.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
But there the majestic One, the Lord, will be for us
A place of rivers and wide canals
On which no boat with oars will go,
And on which no mighty ship will pass—
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord is our judge,
The Lord is our lawgiver,
The Lord is our king;
He will save us—
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
And no resident will say, “I am sick”;
The people who live there will be forgiven their wrongdoing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Come near, you nations, to hear; and listen, you peoples!
Let the earth and all it contains hear, and the world and all that springs from it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord’s anger is against all the nations,
And His wrath against all their armies.
He has utterly destroyed them,
He has turned them over to slaughter.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So their slain will be thrown out,
And their corpses will give off their stench,
And the mountains will be drenched with their blood.
speaker: Narrator

text:
And all the heavenly lights will wear away,
And the sky will be rolled up like a scroll;
All its lights will also wither away
As a leaf withers from the vine,
Or as one withers from the fig tree.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The sword of the Lord is filled with blood,
It drips with fat, with the blood of lambs and goats,
With the fat of the kidneys of rams.
For the Lord has a sacrifice in Bozrah,
And a great slaughter in the land of Edom.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Wild oxen will also fall with them
And young bulls with strong ones;
So their land will be soaked with blood,
And their dust become greasy with fat.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord has a day of vengeance,
A year of retribution for the cause of Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Its streams will be turned into pitch,
And its loose earth into brimstone,
And its land will become burning pitch.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
But pelican and hedgehog will possess it,
And owl and raven will dwell in it;
And He will stretch over it the line of desolation
And the plumb line of emptiness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Its nobles—there is no one there
Whom they may proclaim king—
And all its officials will be nothing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Thorns will come up in its fortified towers,
Weeds and thistles in its fortified cities;
It will also be a haunt of jackals
And a habitat of ostriches.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The desert creatures will meet with the wolves,
The goat also will cry to its kind.
Yes, the night-bird will settle there
And will find herself a resting place.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The tree snake will make its nest and lay eggs there,
And it will hatch and gather them under its protection.
Yes, the hawks will be gathered there,
Every one with its kind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Seek from the book of the Lord, and read:
Not one of these will be missing;
None will lack its mate.
For His mouth has commanded,
And His Spirit has gathered them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has cast the lot for them,
And His hand has divided it to them by the measuring line.
They shall possess it forever;
From generation to generation they will dwell in it.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
It will blossom profusely
And rejoice with joy and jubilation.
The glory of Lebanon will be given to it,
The majesty of Carmel and Sharon.
They will see the glory of the Lord,
The majesty of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Strengthen the exhausted, and make the feeble strong.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Say to those with anxious heart,
“Take courage, fear not.
Behold, your God will come with vengeance;
The retribution of God will come,
But He will save you.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then the eyes of those who are blind will be opened,
And the ears of those who are deaf will be unstopped.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Then those who limp will leap like a deer,
And the tongue of those who cannot speak will shout for joy.
For waters will burst forth in the wilderness,
And streams in the desert.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The scorched land will become a pool
And the thirsty ground springs of water;
In the haunt of jackals, its resting place,
Grass becomes reeds and rushes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
A highway will be there, a roadway,
And it will be called the Highway of Holiness.
The unclean will not travel on it,
But it will be for the one who walks that way,
And fools will not wander on it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
No lion will be there,
Nor will any vicious animal go up on it;
They will not be found there.
But the redeemed will walk there,
speaker: Narrator

text:
And the redeemed of the Lord will return
And come to Zion with joyful shouting,
And everlasting joy will be on their heads.
They will obtain gladness and joy,
And sorrow and sighing will flee away.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now in the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah, Sennacherib king of Assyria marched against all the fortified cities of Judah and seized them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king of Assyria sent Rabshakeh from Lachish to Jerusalem to King Hezekiah with a large army. And he stood by the conduit of the upper pool on the road to the fuller’s field.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, who was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah the son of Asaph, the secretary, went out to him.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Rabshakeh said to them, “Say now to Hezekiah, ‘This is what the great king, the king of Assyria says: “What is this confidence that you have?
speaker: Narrator

text: I say, ‘Your plan and strength for the war are only empty words.’ Now on whom have you relied, that you have revolted against me?
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, you have relied on the staff of this broken reed, on Egypt, on which if a man leans, it will go into his hand and pierce it. So is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all who rely on him.
speaker: Narrator

text: But if you say to me, ‘We trust in the Lord our God,’ is it not He whose high places and whose altars Hezekiah has taken away and has said to Judah and to Jerusalem, ‘You shall worship before this altar’?
speaker: Narrator

text: Now then, come make a wager with my master the king of Assyria: I will give you two thousand horses, if you are able on your part to put riders on them!
speaker: Narrator

text: How then can you drive back even one official of the least of my master’s servants and rely on Egypt for chariots and horsemen?
speaker: Narrator

text: And have I now come up without the Lord’s approval against this land to destroy it? The Lord said to me, ‘Go up against this land and destroy it.’”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Eliakim, Shebna, and Joah said to Rabshakeh, “Please speak to your servants in Aramaic, for we understand it; and do not speak to us in Judean so that the people who are on the wall hear you.”
speaker: Narrator

text: But Rabshakeh said, “Has my master sent me only to your master and to you to speak these words, and not to the men who sit on the wall, doomed to eat their own dung and drink their own urine with you?”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Rabshakeh stood and called out with a loud voice in Judean and said, “Hear the words of the great king, the king of Assyria!
speaker: Narrator

text: This is what the king says: ‘Do not let Hezekiah deceive you, for he will not be able to save you;
speaker: Narrator

text: and do not let Hezekiah lead you to rely on the Lord, saying, “The Lord will certainly save us. This city will not be handed over to the king of Assyria!”
speaker: Narrator

text: Do not listen to Hezekiah,’ for this is what the king of Assyria says: ‘Surrender to me and come out to me, and eat, each one, of his vine and each of his fig tree, and each drink of the waters of his own cistern,
speaker: Narrator

text: until I come and take you away to a land like your own land, a land of grain and new wine, a land of bread and vineyards.
speaker: Narrator

text: Beware that Hezekiah does not mislead you, saying, “The Lord will save us.” Has any one of the gods of the nations saved his land from the hand of the king of Assyria?
speaker: Narrator

text: Where are the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim? And when have they saved Samaria from my hand?
speaker: Narrator

text: Who among all the gods of these lands have saved their land from my hand, that the Lord would save Jerusalem from my hand?’”
speaker: Narrator

text: But they were silent and did not answer him so much as a word; for the king’s command was, “Do not answer him.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, who was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah the son of Asaph, the secretary, came to Hezekiah with their clothes torn, and reported to him the words of Rabshakeh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when King Hezekiah heard the report, he tore his clothes, covered himself with sackcloth, and entered the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he sent Eliakim, who was in charge of the household, with Shebna the scribe and the elders of the priests, covered with sackcloth, to Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said to him, “This is what Hezekiah says: ‘This day is a day of distress, rebuke, and humiliation; for children have come to the point of birth, and there is no strength to deliver them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Perhaps the Lord your God will hear the words of Rabshakeh, whom his master the king of Assyria has sent to taunt the living God, and will avenge the words which the Lord your God has heard. Therefore, offer a prayer for the remnant that is left.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: So the servants of King Hezekiah came to Isaiah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Isaiah said to them, “This is what you shall say to your master: ‘This is what the Lord says: “Do not be afraid because of the words that you have heard, with which the servants of the king of Assyria have blasphemed Me.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I am going to put a spirit in him so that he will hear news and return to his own land. And I will make him fall by the sword in his own land.”’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Rabshakeh returned and found the king of Assyria fighting against Libnah, for he had heard that the king had left Lachish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now he heard them say regarding Tirhakah king of Cush, “He has come out to fight against you,” and when he heard it he sent messengers to Hezekiah, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “This is what you shall say to Hezekiah king of Judah: ‘Do not let your God in whom you trust deceive you by saying, “Jerusalem will not be handed over to the king of Assyria.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, you yourself have heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all the lands, destroying them completely. So will you be saved?
speaker: Narrator

text: Did the gods of the nations which my fathers destroyed save them: Gozan, Haran, Rezeph, and the sons of Eden who were in Telassar?
speaker: Narrator

text: Where is the king of Hamath, the king of Arpad, the king of the city of Sepharvaim, and of Hena and Ivvah?’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Hezekiah took the letter from the hand of the messengers and read it, and he went up to the house of the Lord and spread it out before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hezekiah prayed to the Lord, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Lord of armies, God of Israel, who is enthroned above the cherubim, You are the God, You alone, of all the kingdoms of the earth. You made heaven and earth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Incline Your ear, Lord, and hear; open Your eyes, Lord, and see; and listen to all the words of Sennacherib, who sent them to taunt the living God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Truly, Lord, the kings of Assyria have laid waste all the countries and their lands,
speaker: Narrator

text: and have thrown their gods into the fire, for they were not gods but only the work of human hands, wood and stone. So they have destroyed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But now Lord, our God, save us from his hand, so that all the kingdoms of the earth may know that You alone, Lord, are God.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Isaiah the son of Amoz sent word to Hezekiah, saying, “This is what the Lord, the God of Israel says: ‘Because you have prayed to Me about Sennacherib king of Assyria,
speaker: Narrator

text:
this is the word that the Lord has spoken against him:
“She has shown contempt for you and derided you,
The virgin daughter of Zion;
The daughter of Jerusalem has shaken her head behind you!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Whom have you taunted and blasphemed?
And against whom have you raised your voice
And haughtily raised your eyes?
Against the Holy One of Israel!
speaker: Narrator

text:
Through your servants you have taunted the Lord,
And you have said, ‘With my many chariots I came up to the heights of the mountains,
To the remotest parts of Lebanon;
And I cut down its tall cedars and its choice junipers.
And I will come to its highest peak, its thickest forest.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I dug wells and drank waters,
And with the sole of my feet I dried up
All the canals of Egypt.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
Have you not heard?
Long ago I did it,
From ancient times I planned it.
Now I have brought it about
That you would turn fortified cities into ruined heaps.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore their inhabitants were powerless,
They were shattered and put to shame;
They were like the vegetation of the field and the green grass,
Like grass on the housetops that is scorched before it has grown.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I know your sitting down,
Your going out, your coming in,
And your raging against Me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because of your raging against Me
And because your complacency has come up to My ears,
I will put My hook in your nose
And My bridle in your lips,
And I will turn you back by the way that you came.
speaker: Narrator

text: “Then this shall be the sign for you: you will eat this year what grows of itself, in the second year what grows from the same, and in the third year sow, harvest, plant vineyards, and eat their fruit.
speaker: Narrator

text: The survivors that are left of the house of Judah will again take root downward and bear fruit upward.
speaker: Narrator

text: For out of Jerusalem a remnant will go, and out of Mount Zion survivors. The zeal of the Lord of armies will perform this.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: “Therefore, this is what the Lord says about the king of Assyria: ‘He will not come to this city nor shoot an arrow there; and he will not come before it with a shield, nor heap up an assault ramp against it.
speaker: Narrator

text: By the way that he came, by the same he will return, and he will not come to this city,’ declares the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘For I will protect this city to save it for My own sake, and for My servant David’s sake.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the angel of the Lord went out and struck 185,000 in the camp of the Assyrians; and when the rest got up early in the morning, behold, all of the 185,000 were dead.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Sennacherib the king of Assyria departed and returned home and lived in Nineveh.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it came about, as he was worshiping in the house of Nisroch his god, that his sons Adrammelech and Sharezer killed him with the sword; and they escaped to the land of Ararat. And his son Esarhaddon became king in his place.
speaker: Narrator

text: In those days Hezekiah became mortally ill. And Isaiah the prophet, the son of Amoz, came to him and said to him, “This is what the Lord says: ‘Set your house in order, for you are going to die and not live.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Hezekiah turned his face to the wall and prayed to the Lord,
speaker: Narrator

text: and said, “Please, Lord, just remember how I have walked before You wholeheartedly and in truth, and have done what is good in Your sight.” And Hezekiah wept profusely.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the word of the Lord came to Isaiah, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: “Go and say to Hezekiah, ‘This is what the Lord, the God of your father David says: “I have heard your prayer, I have seen your tears; behold, I will add fifteen years to your life.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I will save you and this city from the hand of the king of Assyria; and I will protect this city.”’
speaker: Narrator

text: “And this shall be the sign to you from the Lord, that the Lord will perform this word that He has spoken:
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I will make the shadow on the stairway, which has gone down with the sun on the stairway of Ahaz, go back ten steps.” So the sun’s shadow went back ten steps on the stairway on which it had gone down.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is a writing of Hezekiah king of Judah after his illness and recovery:
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
I composed my soul until morning.
Like a lion—so He breaks all my bones,
From day until night You make an end of me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
It is the living who give thanks to You, as I do today;
A father tells his sons about Your faithfulness.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: Now Isaiah had said, “Have them take a cake of figs and apply it to the boil, so that he may recover.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Hezekiah had said, “What is the sign that I will go up to the house of the Lord?”
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time Merodach-baladan son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and a gift to Hezekiah, for he heard that he had been sick and had recovered.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hezekiah was pleased, and let them see all his treasure house, the silver, the gold, the balsam oil, the excellent olive oil, his entire armory, and everything that was found in his treasuries. There was nothing in his house nor in all his realm that Hezekiah did not let them see.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Isaiah the prophet came to King Hezekiah and said to him, “What did these men say, and from where did they come to you?” And Hezekiah said, “They came to me from a far country, from Babylon.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then he said, “What have they seen in your house?” So Hezekiah answered, “They have seen everything that is in my house; there is nothing among my treasuries that I have not let them see.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Isaiah then said to Hezekiah, “Hear the word of the Lord of armies,
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘Behold, the days are coming when everything that is in your house, and what your fathers have stored up to this day, will be carried to Babylon; nothing will be left,’ says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: ‘And some of your sons who will come from you, whom you will father, will be taken away, and they will become eunuchs in the palace of the king of Babylon.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Hezekiah said to Isaiah, “The word of the Lord which you have spoken is good.” For he thought, “For there will be peace and truth in my days.”
speaker: Narrator

text: “Comfort, comfort My people,” says your God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Speak kindly to Jerusalem;
And call out to her, that her warfare has ended,
That her guilt has been removed,
That she has received of the Lord’s hand
Double for all her sins.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
A voice says, “Call out.”
Then he answered, “What shall I call out?”
All flesh is grass, and all its loveliness is like the flower of the field.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
The grass withers, the flower fades,
But the word of our God stands forever.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Go up on a high mountain,
Zion, messenger of good news,
Raise your voice forcefully,
Jerusalem, messenger of good news;
Raise it up, do not fear.
Say to the cities of Judah,
“Here is your God!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, the Lord God will come with might,
With His arm ruling for Him.
Behold, His compensation is with Him,
And His reward before Him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Like a shepherd He will tend His flock,
In His arm He will gather the lambs
And carry them in the fold of His robe;
He will gently lead the nursing ewes.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who has measured the waters in the hollow of His hand,
And measured the heavens with a span,
And calculated the dust of the earth with a measure,
And weighed the mountains in a balance
And the hills in a pair of scales?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who has directed the Spirit of the Lord,
Or as His counselor has informed Him?
speaker: Narrator

text:
With whom did He consult and who gave Him understanding?
And who taught Him in the path of justice and taught Him knowledge,
And informed Him of the way of understanding?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Even Lebanon is not enough to burn,
Nor its animals enough for a burnt offering.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All the nations are as nothing before Him,
They are regarded by Him as less than nothing and meaningless.
speaker: Narrator

text:
To whom then will you liken God?
Or what likeness will you compare with Him?
speaker: Narrator

text:
As for the idol, a craftsman casts it,
A goldsmith plates it with gold,
And a silversmith fashions chains of silver.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who is too impoverished for such an offering
Selects a tree that does not rot;
He seeks out for himself a skillful craftsman
To prepare an idol that will not totter.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do you not know? Have you not heard?
Has it not been declared to you from the beginning?
Have you not understood from the foundations of the earth?
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is He who sits above the circle of the earth,
And its inhabitants are like grasshoppers,
Who stretches out the heavens like a curtain
And spreads them out like a tent to live in.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is He who reduces rulers to nothing,
Who makes the judges of the earth meaningless.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Scarcely have they been planted,
Scarcely have they been sown,
Scarcely has their stock taken root in the earth,
But He merely blows on them, and they wither,
And the storm carries them away like stubble.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“To whom then will you compare Me
That I would be his equal?” says the Holy One.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Raise your eyes on high
And see who has created these stars,
The One who brings out their multitude by number,
He calls them all by name;
Because of the greatness of His might and the strength of His power,
Not one of them is missing.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why do you say, Jacob, and you assert, Israel,
“My way is hidden from the Lord,
And the justice due me escapes the notice of my God”?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do you not know? Have you not heard?
The Everlasting God, the Lord, the Creator of the ends of the earth
Does not become weary or tired.
His understanding is unsearchable.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He gives strength to the weary,
And to the one who lacks might He increases power.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Though youths grow weary and tired,
And vigorous young men stumble badly,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet those who wait for the Lord
Will gain new strength;
They will mount up with wings like eagles,
They will run and not get tired,
They will walk and not become weary.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Who has stirred one from the east
Whom He calls in righteousness to His feet?
He turns nations over to him
And subdues kings.
He makes them like dust with his sword,
Like the wind-driven chaff with his bow.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He pursues them, passing on in safety,
By a way he had not been traversing with his feet.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who has performed and accomplished it,
Summoning the generations from the beginning?
‘I, the Lord, am the first, and with the last. I am He.’”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Each one helps his neighbor
And says to his brother, “Be strong!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
So the craftsman encourages the smelter,
And he who smooths metal with the hammer encourages him who beats the anvil,
Saying of the soldering, “It is good”;
And he fastens it with nails,
So that it will not totter.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“But you, Israel, My servant,
Jacob whom I have chosen,
Descendant of Abraham My friend,
speaker: Narrator

text:
You whom I have taken from the ends of the earth
And called from its remotest parts,
And said to you, ‘You are My servant,
I have chosen you and have not rejected you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not fear, for I am with you;
Do not be afraid, for I am your God.
I will strengthen you, I will also help you,
I will also uphold you with My righteous right hand.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, all those who are angered at you will be shamed and dishonored;
Those who contend with you will be as nothing and will perish.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You will seek those who quarrel with you, but will not find them,
Those who war with you will be as nothing and non-existent.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I am the Lord your God who takes hold of your right hand,
Who says to you, ‘Do not fear, I will help you.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not fear, you worm Jacob, you people of Israel;
I will help you,” declares the Lord, “and your Redeemer is the Holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
You will winnow them, and the wind will carry them away,
And the storm will scatter them;
But you will rejoice in the Lord,
You will boast in the Holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“The poor and needy are seeking water, but there is none,
And their tongues are parched with thirst.
I, the Lord, will answer them Myself;
As the God of Israel I will not abandon them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will open rivers on the bare heights,
And springs in the midst of the valleys;
I will make the wilderness a pool of water,
And the dry land fountains of water.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will put the cedar in the wilderness,
The acacia, the myrtle, and the olive tree;
I will place the juniper in the desert,
Together with the elm tree and the cypress,
speaker: Narrator

text:
So that they may see and recognize,
And consider and gain insight as well,
That the hand of the Lord has done this,
And the Holy One of Israel has created it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Present your case,” the Lord says.
“Bring forward your evidence,”
The King of Jacob says.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Behold, you are less than nothing,
And your work is less than nothing!
He who chooses you is an abomination.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Who has declared this from the beginning, that we might know?
Or from former times, that we may say, “He is right!”?
There was no one at all who declared,
There was no one at all who proclaimed,
There was no one at all who heard your words.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Previously I said to Zion, ‘Behold, here they are.’
And to Jerusalem, ‘I will give a messenger of good news.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
But when I look, there is no one,
And there is no counselor among them
Who, if I ask, can give an answer.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
He will not cry out nor raise His voice,
Nor make His voice heard in the street.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
This is what God the Lord says,
Who created the heavens and stretched them out,
Who spread out the earth and its offspring,
Who gives breath to the people on it
And spirit to those who walk in it:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“I am the Lord, I have called You in righteousness,
I will also hold You by the hand and watch over You,
And I will appoint You as a covenant to the people,
As a light to the nations,
speaker: Narrator

text:
To open blind eyes,
To bring out prisoners from the dungeon
And those who dwell in darkness from the prison.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
Sing to the Lord a new song,
Sing His praise from the end of the earth!
You who go down to the sea, and all that is in it;
You islands, and those who live on them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the wilderness and its cities raise their voices,
The settlements which Kedar inhabits.
Let the inhabitants of Sela sing aloud,
Let them shout for joy from the tops of the mountains.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let them give glory to the Lord
And declare His praise in the coastlands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord will go out like a warrior,
He will stir His zeal like a man of war.
He will shout, indeed, He will raise a war cry.
He will prevail against His enemies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“I have kept silent for a long time,
I have kept still and restrained Myself.
Now like a woman in labor I will groan,
I will both gasp and pant.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will lay waste the mountains and hills
And wither all their vegetation;
I will turn the rivers into coastlands
And dry up the ponds.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will lead those who are blind by a way they have not known,
In paths they have not known I will guide them.
I will turn darkness into light before them
And uneven land into plains.
These are the things I will do,
And I will not leave them undone.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will be turned back and be utterly put to shame,
Who trust in idols,
Who say to cast metal images,
“You are our gods.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Hear, you who are deaf!
And look, you who are blind, so that you may see.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who is blind but My servant,
Or so deaf as My messenger whom I send?
Who is so blind as one who is at peace with Me,
Or so blind as the servant of the Lord?
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have seen many things, but you do not retain them;
Your ears are open, but no one hears.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord was pleased for His righteousness’ sake
To make the Law great and glorious.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Who among you will listen to this?
Who will pay attention and listen in the time to come?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who gave Jacob up for spoils, and Israel to plunderers?
Was it not the Lord, against whom we have sinned,
And in whose ways they were not willing to walk,
And whose Law they did not obey?
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
But now, this is what the Lord says, He who is your Creator, Jacob,
And He who formed you, Israel:
“Do not fear, for I have redeemed you;
I have called you by name; you are Mine!
speaker: Narrator

text:
When you pass through the waters, I will be with you;
And through the rivers, they will not overflow you.
When you walk through the fire, you will not be scorched,
Nor will the flame burn you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For I am the Lord your God,
The Holy One of Israel, your Savior;
I have given Egypt as your ransom,
Cush and Seba in exchange for you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Since you are precious in My sight,
Since you are honored and I love you,
I will give other people in your place and other nations in exchange for your life.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I will say to the north, ‘Give them up!’
And to the south, ‘Do not hold them back.’
Bring My sons from afar
And My daughters from the ends of the earth,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Everyone who is called by My name,
And whom I have created for My glory,
Whom I have formed, even whom I have made.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Bring out the people who are blind, even though they have eyes,
And those who are deaf, even though they have ears.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All the nations have gathered together
So that the peoples may be assembled.
Who among them can declare this
And proclaim to us the former things?
Let them present their witnesses so that they may be justified,
Or let them hear and say, “It is true.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
“You are My witnesses,” declares the Lord,
“And My servant whom I have chosen,
So that you may know and believe Me
And understand that I am He.
Before Me there was no God formed,
And there will be none after Me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I, only I, am the Lord,
And there is no savior besides Me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is I who have declared and saved and proclaimed,
And there was no strange god among you;
So you are My witnesses,” declares the Lord,
“And I am God.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
This is what the Lord your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel says:
“For your sake I have sent to Babylon,
And will bring them all down as fugitives,
Even the Chaldeans, into the ships over which they rejoice.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am the Lord, your Holy One,
The Creator of Israel, your King.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is what the Lord says,
He who makes a way through the sea
And a path through the mighty waters,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who brings out the chariot and the horse,
The army and the mighty man
(They will lie down together and not rise again;
They have been extinguished, and have gone out like a wick):
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Do not call to mind the former things,
Or consider things of the past.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, I am going to do something new,
Now it will spring up;
Will you not be aware of it?
I will even make a roadway in the wilderness,
Rivers in the desert.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The animals of the field will glorify Me,
The jackals and the ostriches,
Because I have given waters in the wilderness
And rivers in the desert,
To give drink to My chosen people.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The people whom I formed for Myself
Will declare My praise.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Yet you have not called on Me, Jacob;
But you have become weary of Me, Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have not brought to Me the sheep of your burnt offerings,
Nor have you honored Me with your sacrifices.
I have not burdened you with offerings,
Nor wearied you with incense.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have not bought Me sweet cane with money,
Nor have you satisfied Me with the fat of your sacrifices;
Rather, you have burdened Me with your sins,
You have wearied Me with your wrongdoings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“I, I alone, am the one who wipes out your wrongdoings for My own sake,
And I will not remember your sins.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Meet Me in court, let’s argue our case together;
State your cause, so that you may be proved right.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Your first forefather sinned,
And your spokesmen have rebelled against Me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So I will profane the officials of the sanctuary,
And I will turn Jacob over to destruction and Israel to abuse.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“But now listen, Jacob, My servant,
And Israel, whom I have chosen:
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is what the Lord says, He who made you
And formed you from the womb, who will help you:
‘Do not fear, Jacob My servant,
And Jeshurun, whom I have chosen.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
And they will spring up among the grass
Like poplars by streams of water.’
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“This is what the Lord says, He who is the King of Israel and his Redeemer, the Lord of armies:
‘I am the first and I am the last,
And there is no God besides Me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who is like Me? Let him proclaim and declare it;
And, let him confront Me
Beginning with My establishing of the ancient nation.
Then let them declare to them the things that are coming
And the events that are going to take place.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Do not tremble and do not be afraid;
Have I not long since announced it to you and declared it?
And you are My witnesses.
Is there any God besides Me,
Or is there any other Rock?
I know of none.’”
speaker: Narrator

text: Those who fashion an idol are all futile, and their treasured things are of no benefit; even their own witnesses fail to see or know, so that they will be put to shame.
speaker: Narrator

text: Who has fashioned a god or cast an idol to no benefit?
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, all his companions will be put to shame, for the craftsmen themselves are mere men. Let them all assemble themselves, let them stand up, let them tremble, let them be put to shame together.
speaker: Narrator

text: The craftsman of iron shapes a cutting tool and does his work over the coals, fashioning it with hammers and working it with his strong arm. He also gets hungry and his strength fails; he drinks no water and becomes weary.
speaker: Narrator

text: The craftsman of wood extends a measuring line; he outlines it with a marker. He works it with carving knives and outlines it with a compass, and makes it like the form of a man, like the beauty of mankind, so that it may sit in a house.
speaker: Narrator

text: He will cut cedars for himself, and he takes a holm-oak or another oak and lets it grow strong for himself among the trees of the forest. He plants a laurel tree, and the rain makes it grow.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then it becomes something for a person to burn, so he takes one of them and gets warm; he also makes a fire and bakes bread. He also makes a god and worships it; he makes it a carved image and bows down before it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Half of it he burns in the fire; over this half he eats meat, he roasts a roast, and is satisfied. He also warms himself and says, “Aha! I am warm, I have seen the fire.”
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet the rest of it he makes into a god, his carved image. He bows down before it and worships; he also prays to it and says, “Save me, for you are my god.”
speaker: Narrator

text: They do not know, nor do they understand, for He has smeared over their eyes so that they cannot see, and their hearts so that they cannot comprehend.
speaker: Narrator

text: No one remembers, nor is there knowledge or understanding to say, “I have burned half of it in the fire and also have baked bread over its coals. I roast meat and eat it. Then I make the rest of it into an abomination, I bow down before a block of wood!”
speaker: Narrator

text: He feeds on ashes; a deceived heart has misled him. And he cannot save himself, nor say, “Is there not a lie in my right hand?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Remember these things, Jacob,
And Israel, for you are My servant;
I have formed you, you are My servant,
Israel, you will not be forgotten by Me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have wiped out your wrongdoings like a thick cloud
And your sins like a heavy mist.
Return to Me, for I have redeemed you.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
This is what the Lord says, He who is your Redeemer, and the One who formed you from the womb:
“I, the Lord, am the Maker of all things,
Stretching out the heavens by Myself
And spreading out the earth alone,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Causing the omens of diviners to fail,
Making fools of fortune-tellers;
Causing wise men to turn back
And making their knowledge ridiculous,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Confirming the word of His servant
And carrying out the purpose of His messengers.
It is I who says of Jerusalem, ‘She shall be inhabited!’
And of the cities of Judah, ‘They shall be built.’
And I will raise her ruins again.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I am the One who says to the depth of the sea, ‘Dry up!’
And I will make your rivers dry up.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is I who says of Cyrus, ‘He is My shepherd,
And he will carry out all My desire.’
And he says of Jerusalem, ‘She will be built,’
And of the temple, ‘Your foundation will be laid.’”
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is what the Lord says to Cyrus His anointed,
Whom I have taken by the right hand,
To subdue nations before him
And to undo the weapons belt on the waist of kings;
To open doors before him so that gates will not be shut:
speaker: Narrator

text:
“I will go before you and make the rough places smooth;
I will shatter the doors of bronze and cut through their iron bars.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will give you the treasures of darkness
And hidden wealth of secret places,
So that you may know that it is I,
The Lord, the God of Israel, who calls you by your name.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the sake of Jacob My servant,
And Israel My chosen one,
I have also called you by your name;
I have given you a title of honor
Though you have not known Me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
So that people may know from the rising to the setting of the sun
That there is no one besides Me.
I am the Lord, and there is no one else,
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“Drip down, heavens, from above,
And let the clouds pour down righteousness;
Let the earth open up and salvation bear fruit,
And righteousness sprout with it.
I, the Lord, have created it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Woe to the one who quarrels with his Maker—
A piece of pottery among the other earthenware pottery pieces!
Will the clay say to the potter, ‘What are you doing?’
Or the thing you are making say, ‘He has no hands’?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Woe to him who says to a father, ‘What are you fathering?’
Or to a woman, ‘To what are you giving birth?’”
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is what the Lord says, the Holy One of Israel and his Maker:
“Ask Me about the things to come concerning My sons,
And you shall commit to Me the work of My hands.
speaker: Narrator

text:
It is I who made the earth, and created mankind upon it.
I stretched out the heavens with My hands,
And I ordained all their lights.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have stirred him in righteousness,
And I will make all his ways smooth.
He will build My city and let My exiles go free,
Without any payment or reward,” says the Lord of armies.
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is what the Lord says:
“The products of Egypt and the merchandise of Cush
And the Sabeans, men of stature,
Will come over to you and will be yours;
They will walk behind you, they will come over in chains
And will bow down to you;
They will plead with you:
‘God certainly is with you, and there is no one else,
No other God.’”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Truly, You are a God who hides Himself,
God of Israel, Savior!
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will be put to shame and even humiliated, all of them;
The manufacturers of idols will go away together in humiliation.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Israel has been saved by the Lord
With an everlasting salvation;
You will not be put to shame or humiliated
To all eternity.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For this is what the Lord says, He who created the heavens (He is the God who formed the earth and made it, He established it and did not create it as a waste place, but formed it to be inhabited):
“I am the Lord, and there is no one else.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“Gather yourselves and come;
Come together, you survivors of the nations!
They have no knowledge,
Who carry around their wooden idol
And pray to a god who cannot save.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Declare and present your case;
Indeed, let them consult together.
Who has announced this long ago?
Who has long since declared it?
Is it not I, the Lord?
And there is no other God besides Me,
A righteous God and a Savior;
There is none except Me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Turn to Me and be saved, all the ends of the earth;
For I am God, and there is no other.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I have sworn by Myself;
The word has gone out from My mouth in righteousness
And will not turn back,
That to Me every knee will bow, every tongue will swear allegiance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will say of Me, ‘Only in the Lord are righteousness and strength.’
People will come to Him,
And all who were angry at Him will be put to shame.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In the Lord all the offspring of Israel
Will be justified and will boast.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Bel has bowed down, Nebo stoops over;
Their idols have become loads for the animals and the cattle.
The things that you carry are burdensome,
A load for the weary animal.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“Listen to Me, house of Jacob,
And all the remnant of the house of Israel,
You who have been carried by Me from birth
And have been carried from the womb;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Even to your old age I will be the same,
And even to your graying years I will carry you!
I have done it, and I will bear you;
And I will carry you and I will save you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“To whom would you liken Me
And make Me equal, and compare Me,
That we would be alike?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Those who lavish gold from the bag
And weigh silver on the scale,
Hire a goldsmith, and he makes it into a god;
They bow down, indeed they worship it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They lift it on the shoulder, carry it,
And set it in its place, and it stands there.
It does not move from its place.
Though one may shout to it, it cannot answer;
It cannot save him from his distress.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Remember this, and be assured;
Recall it to mind, you wrongdoers.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Declaring the end from the beginning,
And from ancient times things which have not been done,
Saying, ‘My plan will be established,
And I will accomplish all My good pleasure’;
speaker: Narrator

text:
Calling a bird of prey from the east,
The man of My purpose from a distant country.
Truly I have spoken; truly I will bring it to pass.
I have planned it, I will certainly do it.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Listen to Me, you stubborn-minded,
Who are far from righteousness.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I bring near My righteousness, it is not far off;
And My salvation will not delay.
And I will grant salvation in Zion,
And My glory for Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Come down and sit in the dust,
Virgin daughter of Babylon;
Sit on the ground without a throne,
Daughter of the Chaldeans!
For you will no longer be called tender and delicate.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Take the millstones and grind flour.
Remove your veil, strip off the skirt,
Uncover the leg, cross the rivers.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Our Redeemer, the Lord of armies is His name,
The Holy One of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Sit silently, and go into darkness,
Daughter of the Chaldeans;
For you will no longer be called
The queen of kingdoms.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I was angry with My people,
I profaned My heritage
And handed them over to you.
You did not show mercy to them,
On the aged you made your yoke very heavy.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Yet you said, ‘I will be a queen forever.’
These things you did not consider
Nor remember the outcome of them.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Now, then, hear this, you luxuriant one,
Who lives securely,
Who says in her heart,
‘I am, and there is no one besides me.
I will not sit as a widow,
Nor know the loss of children.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
But these two things will come on you suddenly in one day:
Loss of children and widowhood.
They will come on you in full measure
In spite of your many sorceries,
In spite of the great power of your spells.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You felt secure in your wickedness and said,
‘No one sees me,’
Your wisdom and your knowledge, they have led you astray;
For you have said in your heart,
‘I am, and there is no one besides me.’
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“Persist now in your spells
And in your many sorceries
With which you have labored from your youth;
Perhaps you will be able to benefit,
Perhaps you may cause trembling.
speaker: Narrator

text:
You are wearied with your many counsels;
Let now the astrologers,
Those who prophesy by the stars,
Those who predict by the new moons,
Stand up and save you from what will come upon you.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
“Hear this, house of Jacob, who are named Israel
And who came from the waters of Judah,
Who swear by the name of the Lord
And invoke the God of Israel,
But not in truth nor in righteousness.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
I declared the former things long ago,
And they went out of My mouth, and I proclaimed them.
Suddenly I acted, and they came to pass.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Because I know that you are obstinate,
And your neck is an iron tendon
And your forehead bronze,
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore I declared them to you long ago,
Before they took place I proclaimed them to you,
So that you would not say, ‘My idol has done them,
And my carved image and my cast metal image have commanded them.’
speaker: Narrator

text:
You have heard; look at all this.
And you, will you not declare it?
I proclaim to you new things from this time,
Hidden things which you have not known.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
You have not heard, you have not known.
Even from long ago your ear has not been open,
Because I knew that you would deal very treacherously;
And you have been called a rebel from birth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the sake of My name I delay My wrath,
And for My praise I restrain it for you,
In order not to cut you off.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, I have refined you, but not as silver;
I have tested you in the furnace of affliction.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“Listen to Me, Jacob, Israel whom I called;
I am He, I am the first, I am also the last.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Assemble, all of you, and listen!
Who among them has declared these things?
The Lord loves him; he will carry out His good pleasure against Babylon,
And His arm will be against the Chaldeans.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I, yes I, have spoken; indeed I have called him,
I have brought him, and He will make his ways successful.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Come near to Me, listen to this:
From the beginning I have not spoken in secret,
From the time it took place, I was there.
And now the Lord God has sent Me, and His Spirit.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is what the Lord says, He who is your Redeemer, the Holy One of Israel:
“I am the Lord your God, who teaches you to benefit,
Who leads you in the way you should go.
speaker: Narrator

text:
If only you had paid attention to My commandments!
Then your well-being would have been like a river,
And your righteousness like the waves of the sea.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Go out from Babylon! Flee from the Chaldeans!
Declare with the sound of joyful shouting, proclaim this,
Send it out to the end of the earth;
Say, “The Lord has redeemed His servant Jacob.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text: “There is no peace for the wicked,” says the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen to Me, you islands,
And pay attention, you peoples from afar.
The Lord called Me from the womb;
From the body of My mother He named Me.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He has made My mouth like a sharp sword,
In the shadow of His hand He has concealed Me;
And He has also made Me a sharpened arrow,
He has hidden Me in His quiver.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He said to Me, “You are My Servant, Israel,
In whom I will show My glory.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
But I said, “I have labored in vain,
I have spent My strength for nothing and futility;
Nevertheless, the justice due to Me is with the Lord,
And My reward is with My God.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
And now says the Lord, who formed Me from the womb to be His Servant,
To bring Jacob back to Him, so that Israel might be gathered to Him
(For I am honored in the sight of the Lord,
And My God is My strength),
speaker: Narrator

text:
He says, “It is too small a thing that You should be My Servant
To raise up the tribes of Jacob and to restore the protected ones of Israel;
I will also make You a light of the nations
So that My salvation may reach to the end of the earth.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is what the Lord, the Redeemer of Israel and its Holy One,
Says to the despised One,
To the One abhorred by the nation,
To the Servant of rulers:
“Kings will see and arise,
Princes will also bow down,
Because of the Lord who is faithful, the Holy One of Israel who has chosen You.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Saying to those who are bound, ‘Go free,’
To those who are in darkness, ‘Show yourselves.’
They will feed along the roads,
And their pasture will be on all bare heights.
speaker: Narrator

text:
They will not hunger or thirst,
Nor will the scorching heat or sun strike them down;
For He who has compassion on them will lead them,
And He will guide them to springs of water.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will make all My mountains a road,
And My highways will be raised up.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Shout for joy, you heavens! And rejoice, you earth!
Break forth into joyful shouting, mountains!
For the Lord has comforted His people
And will have compassion on His afflicted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But Zion said, “The Lord has abandoned me,
And the Lord has forgotten me.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Can a woman forget her nursing child
And have no compassion on the son of her womb?
Even these may forget, but I will not forget you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, I have inscribed you on the palms of My hands;
Your walls are continually before Me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Raise your eyes and look around;
All of them gather together, they come to you.
As I live,” declares the Lord,
“You will certainly put them all on as jewelry and bind them on as a bride.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For your ruins and deserted places and your destroyed land—
Now you will certainly be too cramped for the inhabitants,
And those who swallowed you will be far away.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Then you will say in your heart,
‘Who has fathered these for me,
Since I have been bereaved of my children
And cannot conceive, and I am an exile, and a wanderer?
And who has raised these?
Behold, I was left alone;
Where are these from?’”
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is what the Lord God says:
“Behold, I will lift up My hand to the nations
And set up My flag to the peoples;
And they will bring your sons in their arms,
And your daughters will be carried on their shoulders.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
“Can the prey be taken from a mighty man,
Or the captives of a tyrant be rescued?”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed, this is what the Lord says:
“Even the captives of the mighty man will be taken away,
And the prey of a tyrant will be rescued;
For I will contend with the one who contends with you,
And I will save your sons.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will feed your oppressors with their own flesh,
And they will become drunk with their own blood as with sweet wine;
And humanity will know that I, the Lord, am your Savior
And your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is what the Lord says:
“Where is the certificate of divorce
By which I have sent your mother away?
Or to whom of My creditors did I sell you?
Behold, you were sold for your wrongdoings,
And for your wrongful acts your mother was sent away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why was there no one when I came?
When I called, why was there no one to answer?
Is My hand so short that it cannot redeem?
Or do I have no power to rescue?
Behold, I dry up the sea with My rebuke,
I turn rivers into a wilderness;
Their fish stink for lack of water,
And die of thirst.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I clothe the heavens with blackness,
And make sackcloth their covering.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord God has given Me the tongue of disciples,
So that I may know how to sustain the weary one with a word.
He awakens Me morning by morning,
He awakens My ear to listen as a disciple.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord God has opened My ear,
And I was not disobedient,
Nor did I turn back.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For the Lord God helps Me,
Therefore, I am not disgraced;
Therefore, I have made My face like flint,
And I know that I will not be ashamed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He who vindicates Me is near;
Who will contend with Me?
Let us stand up to each other.
Who has a case against Me?
Let him approach Me.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Who is among you who fears the Lord,
Who obeys the voice of His servant,
Who walks in darkness and has no light?
Let him trust in the name of the Lord and rely on his God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, all you who kindle a fire,
Who encircle yourselves with flaming arrows,
Walk in the light of your fire
And among the flaming arrows you have set ablaze.
This you will have from My hand:
You will lie down in torment.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Listen to Me, you who pursue righteousness,
Who seek the Lord:
Look to the rock from which you were cut,
And to the quarry from which you were dug.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Look to Abraham your father
And to Sarah who gave birth to you in pain;
When he was only one I called him,
Then I blessed him and multiplied him.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Indeed, the Lord will comfort Zion;
He will comfort all her ruins.
And He will make her wilderness like Eden,
And her desert like the garden of the Lord.
Joy and gladness will be found in her,
Thanksgiving and the sound of a melody.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Pay attention to Me, My people,
And listen to Me, My nation;
For a law will go out from Me,
And I will bring My justice as a light of the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text:
My righteousness is near, My salvation has gone forth,
And My arms will judge the peoples;
The coastlands will wait for Me,
And they will wait expectantly for My arm.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Raise your eyes to the sky,
Then look to the earth beneath;
For the sky will vanish like smoke,
And the earth will wear out like a garment
And its inhabitants will die in the same way.
But My salvation will be forever,
And My righteousness will not fail.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen to Me, you who know righteousness,
A people in whose heart is My Law;
Do not fear the taunting of people,
Nor be terrified of their abuses.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the moth will eat them like a garment;
Yes, the moth will eat them like wool.
But My righteousness will be forever,
And My salvation to all generations.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Awake, awake, put on strength, O arm of the Lord;
Awake as in the days of old, the generations of long ago.
Was it not You who cut Rahab in pieces,
Who pierced the dragon?
speaker: Narrator

text:
Was it not You who dried up the sea,
The waters of the great deep;
Who made the depths of the sea a pathway
For the redeemed to cross over?
speaker: Narrator

text:
And the redeemed of the Lord will return
And come to Zion with joyful shouting,
And everlasting joy will be on their heads.
They will obtain gladness and joy,
And sorrow and sighing will flee away.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“I, I Myself, am He who comforts you.
Who are you that you are afraid of mortal man,
And of a son of man who is made like grass,
speaker: Narrator

text:
That you have forgotten the Lord your Maker,
Who stretched out the heavens
And laid the foundations of the earth,
That you fear continually all day long because of the fury of the oppressor,
As he makes ready to destroy?
And where is the rage of the oppressor?
speaker: Narrator

text: The exile will soon be set free, and will not die in the dungeon, nor will his bread be lacking.
speaker: Narrator

text: For I am the Lord your God, who stirs up the sea so that its waves roar (the Lord of armies is His name).
speaker: Narrator

text: And I have put My words in your mouth and have covered you with the shadow of My hand, to establish the heavens, to found the earth, and to say to Zion, ‘You are My people.’”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
There is no one to guide her among all the sons to whom she has given birth,
Nor is there anyone to take her by the hand among all the sons she has raised.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Your sons have fainted,
They lie helpless at the head of every street,
Like an antelope in a net,
Full of the wrath of the Lord,
The rebuke of your God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore, listen to this, you afflicted,
Who are drunk, but not with wine:
speaker: Narrator

text:
This is what your Lord, the Lord, your God
Who contends for His people says:
“Behold, I have taken from your hand the cup of staggering,
The chalice of My anger;
You will never drink it again.
speaker: Narrator

text:
I will put it into the hand of your tormentors,
Who have said to you, ‘Lie down so that we may walk over you.’
You have also made your back like the ground,
And like the street for those who walk over it.”
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
Shake yourself from the dust, rise up,
Captive Jerusalem;
Release yourself from the chains around your neck,
Captive daughter of Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text: For this is what the Lord says: “You were sold for nothing, and you will be redeemed without money.”
speaker: Narrator

text: For this is what the Lord God says: “My people went down to Egypt first to reside there; then the Assyrian oppressed them without reason.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now, what do I have here,” declares the Lord, “seeing that My people have been taken away without reason?” Again the Lord declares, “Those who rule over them howl, and My name is continually reviled all day long.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore, My people shall know My name; therefore on that day I am the one who is speaking, ‘Here I am.’”
speaker: Narrator

text:
How delightful on the mountains
Are the feet of one who brings good news,
Who announces peace
And brings good news of happiness,
Who announces salvation,
And says to Zion, “Your God reigns!”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Listen! Your watchmen raise their voices,
They shout joyfully together;
For they will see with their own eyes
When the Lord restores Zion.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Be cheerful, shout joyfully together,
You ruins of Jerusalem;
For the Lord has comforted His people,
He has redeemed Jerusalem.
speaker: Narrator

text:
The Lord has bared His holy arm
In the sight of all the nations,
So that all the ends of the earth may see
The salvation of our God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Depart, depart, go out from there,
Do not touch what is unclean;
Go out of the midst of her, purify yourselves,
You who carry the vessels of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But you will not go out in a hurry,
Nor will you go as fugitives;
For the Lord will go before you,
And the God of Israel will be your rear guard.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, My Servant will prosper,
He will be high and lifted up and greatly exalted.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Just as many were appalled at you, My people,
So His appearance was marred beyond that of a man,
And His form beyond the sons of mankind.
speaker: Narrator

text:
So He will sprinkle many nations,
Kings will shut their mouths on account of Him;
For what they had not been told, they will see,
And what they had not heard, they will understand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Who has believed our report?
And to whom has the arm of the Lord been revealed?
speaker: Narrator

text:
For He grew up before Him like a tender shoot,
And like a root out of dry ground;
He has no stately form or majesty
That we would look at Him,
Nor an appearance that we would take pleasure in Him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He was despised and abandoned by men,
A man of great pain and familiar with sickness;
And like one from whom people hide their faces,
He was despised, and we had no regard for Him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
However, it was our sicknesses that He Himself bore,
And our pains that He carried;
Yet we ourselves assumed that He had been afflicted,
Struck down by God, and humiliated.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But He was pierced for our offenses,
He was crushed for our wrongdoings;
The punishment for our well-being was laid upon Him,
And by His wounds we are healed.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All of us, like sheep, have gone astray,
Each of us has turned to his own way;
But the Lord has caused the wrongdoing of us all
To fall on Him.
speaker: Narrator

text:
He was oppressed and afflicted,
Yet He did not open His mouth;
Like a lamb that is led to slaughter,
And like a sheep that is silent before its shearers,
So He did not open His mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
By oppression and judgment He was taken away;
And as for His generation, who considered
That He was cut off from the land of the living
For the wrongdoing of my people, to whom the blow was due?
speaker: Narrator

text:
And His grave was assigned with wicked men,
Yet He was with a rich man in His death,
Because He had done no violence,
Nor was there any deceit in His mouth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
But the Lord desired
To crush Him, causing Him grief;
If He renders Himself as a guilt offering,
He will see His offspring,
He will prolong His days,
And the good pleasure of the Lord will prosper in His hand.
speaker: Narrator

text:
As a result of the anguish of His soul,
He will see it and be satisfied;
By His knowledge the Righteous One,
My Servant, will justify the many,
For He will bear their wrongdoings.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Therefore, I will allot Him a portion with the great,
And He will divide the plunder with the strong,
Because He poured out His life unto death,
And was counted with wrongdoers;
Yet He Himself bore the sin of many,
And interceded for the wrongdoers.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator
Narrator

text:
For you will spread out to the right and to the left.
And your descendants will possess nations
And will resettle the desolate cities.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
For your husband is your Maker,
Whose name is the Lord of armies;
And your Redeemer is the Holy One of Israel,
Who is called the God of all the earth.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the Lord has called you,
Like a wife forsaken and grieved in spirit,
Even like a wife of one’s youth when she is rejected,”
Says your God.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“For a brief moment I abandoned you,
But with great compassion I will gather you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
In an outburst of anger
I hid My face from you for a moment,
But with everlasting favor I will have compassion on you,”
Says the Lord your Redeemer.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“For this is like the days of Noah to Me,
When I swore that the waters of Noah
Would not flood the earth again;
So I have sworn that I will not be angry with you
Nor rebuke you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
For the mountains may be removed and the hills may shake,
But My favor will not be removed from you,
Nor will My covenant of peace be shaken,”
Says the Lord who has compassion on you.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“Afflicted one, storm-tossed, and not comforted,
Behold, I will set your stones in antimony,
And I will lay your foundations with sapphires.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Moreover, I will make your battlements of rubies,
And your gates of crystal,
And your entire wall of precious stones.
speaker: Narrator

text:
All your sons will be taught by the Lord;
And the well-being of your sons will be great.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
If anyone fiercely attacks you, it will not be from Me.
Whoever attacks you will fall because of you.
speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:
No weapon that is formed against you will succeed;
And you will condemn every tongue that accuses you in judgment.
This is the heritage of the servants of the Lord,
And their vindication is from Me,” declares the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“You there! Everyone who thirsts, come to the waters;
And you who have no money come, buy and eat.
Come, buy wine and milk
Without money and without cost.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Why do you spend money for what is not bread,
And your wages for what does not satisfy?
Listen carefully to Me, and eat what is good,
And delight yourself in abundance.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Incline your ear and come to Me.
Listen, that you may live;
And I will make an everlasting covenant with you,
According to the faithful mercies shown to David.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, I have made him a witness to the peoples,
A leader and commander for the peoples.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Behold, you will call a nation you do not know,
And a nation which does not know you will run to you,
Because of the Lord your God, the Holy One of Israel;
For He has glorified you.”
speaker: Narrator

text:
Seek the Lord while He may be found;
Call upon Him while He is near.
speaker: Narrator

text:
Let the wicked abandon his way,

text:
“For My thoughts are not your thoughts,
Nor are your ways My ways,” declares the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text:
“For as the heavens are higher than the earth,

text:

text:

speaker: Narrator

text:
For you will go out with joy

text:
Instead of the thorn bush, the juniper will come up,

text:
This is what the Lord says:
“Guard justice and do righteousness,

speaker: Narrator

text:
Blessed is a man who does this,

speaker: Narrator

text:
Let not the foreigner who has joined himself to the Lord say,

text:
For this is what the Lord says:

speaker: Narrator
Narrator

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:

text:
On a high and lofty mountain

text:

text:

text:
